channel.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News Today: Read the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Trump appoints four top advisors as assistants to the president and deputy chiefs of staff
item.description: Former President Donald Trump has brought back four key figures from his 2016 campaign to take on senior roles in his White House. Dan Scavino, Stephen Miller, James Blair, and Taylor Budowich will handle responsibilities ranging from communications and personnel to legislative affairs and policy.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Actor Timothy West passes away at 90
item.description: British actor Timothy West died at 90. He was known for his roles in theatre, television, and film. Some of his notable works include Not Going Out, Bleak House, and Gentleman Jack. West's acting career began at the Wimbledon Theatre. He gained recognition in the 1960s for his performances in Richard II and Edward II.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: DOGE days are coming for the US under Trump's two Musketeers
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump has appointed Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy to lead a new Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) tasked with drastically reducing the size and scope of the federal government by its 250th anniversary. The move has sparked anxiety among federal employees and raised concerns about potential conflicts of interest given Musk and Ramaswamy's business ties to the government.
item.dc:creator: Chidanand Rajghatta

item.title: Democrats push to confirm Biden's federal judge nominees before Trump takes office
item.description: Senate Democrats are racing against the clock to confirm as many of President Biden's judicial nominees as possible before Republicans potentially regain control in January. With 31 nominees awaiting confirmation, Democrats aim to solidify Biden's judicial legacy and prevent a potential influx of Trump-appointed judges.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Massive downsizing': Vivek Ramaswamy reveals how he will ensure government efficiency under Trump
item.description: Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy have been appointed by President-elect Donald Trump to lead the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE). Their mission is to streamline the federal bureaucracy, reduce wasteful spending, and enhance government accountability. Musk emphasized transparency, assuring the public that DOGE's actions will be accessible online.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Deleting a lot of people...': Bride shares pain after 'empty' wedding reception video goes viral
item.description: A bride's dream wedding turned into a nightmare when only five guests showed up to her reception, despite 40 RSVPs. Kalina Marie shared her heartbreak on TikTok, revealing the empty venue and her struggle to understand the mass no-show.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Coercive to students': US judge blocks Louisiana law mandating Ten Commandments in schools
item.description: A Louisiana law mandating the display of the Ten Commandments in public school classrooms has been struck down by a federal judge. Judge John deGravelles deemed the law unconstitutional, citing its discriminatory nature and violation of religious freedom.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Iranian man, once pardoned, hanged again after victimâ€™s family revokes forgiveness
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Bali volcano eruption: Tourists stranded after ash clouds from Mount Lewotobi Laki-laki force flight cancellations
item.description: Volcanic eruptions from Mount Lewotobi Laki-laki in Indonesia forced international airlines to suspend services to and from Bali due to safety concerns over volcanic ash clouds. Thousands of travelers were stranded as flights were canceled, leaving many frustrated and seeking alternative routes home.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Pete Hegseth? Trumpâ€™s choice for US secretary of defence
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump has selected Fox News commentator and veteran Pete Hegseth as his Secretary of Defense. Hegseth, known for his conservative views and support for Trump, has been vocal about his belief in American exceptionalism and a strong military. His appointment follows a pattern of Trump selecting hardliners for his cabinet.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: McCullough Murders: Daughter who murdered 70-year-old parents sentenced to life for double homicide
item.description: A British woman, Virginia McCollough, has been sentenced to life in prison for the horrific murders of her own parents. Driven by greed and a gambling addiction, she poisoned her father and brutally killed her mother, concealing their bodies for over four years while collecting their pensions and selling their belongings.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Earthquake shakes Pakistan; tremors felt in capital Islamabad
item.description: A 5.3 magnitude earthquake, originating in Afghanistan's Hindu Kush region, shook parts of Pakistan, including Islamabad, on Wednesday morning. The tremors, felt across Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa, Islamabad, and Punjab, prompted residents to evacuate their homes. No casualties have been reported.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ex-Congressman Michael Grimm paralysed after Polo accident, friends raise funds for medical expenses
item.description: Former New York Congressman Michael Grimm is facing a long road to recovery after suffering paralysis from the chest down due to a horse-riding accident during a polo tournament in September. The 54-year-old, known for his time in Congress and subsequent tax fraud conviction, is currently undergoing treatment at New Jersey's Kessler Institute for Rehabilitation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: China unveils J-35A jet, becomes second after US with 2 fifth-generation stealth fighters
item.description: China's 2024 Zhuhai Air Show saw the unveiling of the J-35A stealth fighter, marking a significant leap in the nation's military capabilities. The J-35A, designed for air superiority and strike missions, positions China as the second country to operate two fifth-generation fighter types.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Western policy towards children destructive': Russia bans 'liberal propaganda' of childless lifestyle
item.description: Russia's parliament has passed a law banning the 'promotion of childlessness' as part of a larger effort to boost the country's declining birth rate. The law targets media content that encourages people not to have children and includes fines for violations. This move aligns with Russia's ongoing rejection of what it considers 'Western liberal values,' which has also resulted in restrictions on LGBTQ+ rights and adoptions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: â€˜Sad and frustratedâ€™: CNN staff fear sweeping layoffs by March
item.description: CNN employees are bracing for budget cuts and layoffs by March as the network undergoes a business model overhaul. CEO Mark Thompson acknowledges industry challenges and hints at potential cuts, particularly impacting New York City productions. CNN's viewership struggles, notably during election coverage, have fueled concerns about its future direction and impact on talent retention.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Chinese military activity near Taiwan intensifies, 24 PLA aircraft detected
item.description: Taiwan's ministry of national defence detected 24 Chinese aircraft and 6 naval vessels near its territory, with 15 of the aircraft crossing the median line of the Taiwan Strait. This follows a similar incident the previous day. Taiwan's President convened a security meeting, reaffirming their commitment to national security amidst heightened tensions stemming from China's increased military activities.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Day after Brampton temple cancels event, Canada police say 'no direct threats' received against places of worship
item.description: Despite heightened community concerns, Peel Regional Police have assured the public that no direct threats have been made against places of worship. This follows the cancellation of a consular camp at Brampton's Triveni Mandir due to security concerns, prompting calls for increased protection for Hindu Canadians.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'These things always take time': Queen Camilla on mend after chest infection
item.description: Queen Camilla, in her first appearance since November 5th, provided an update on her recovery from a chest infection. Attending a reception for The Booker Prize Foundation at Clarence House, she acknowledged still experiencing some coughing but expressed her determination to attend the event. Camilla, a longtime supporter of the prize, emphasized her improving health while conversing with attendees.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pentagon leaker Jack Teixeira sentenced to 15 years in jail
item.description: Jack Teixeira, a 22-year-old former Air National Guard member, was sentenced to 15 years in prison for leaking classified Pentagon documents. Teixeira pleaded guilty to sharing photos of classified files marked as "Secret" and "Top Secret.
